messages.message:
Was a aws key rotated or did permissioning for sharing metadata change recently? I'm running into 403 errors loading metadata when building api-server

```-f Dockerfile -t instabase/api-server .
#0 building with "default" instance using docker driver

#1 [internal] load build definition from Dockerfile
#1 transferring dockerfile: 1.25kB done
#1 DONE 0.0s

#2 [internal] load metadata for 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17)
#2 ERROR: unexpected status from HEAD request to https://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/v2/instabase-build/python/manifests/3.9.17: 403 Forbidden

#3 [auth] sharing credentials for 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com)
#3 DONE 0.0s
------
 > [internal] load metadata for 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17):
------
Dockerfile:1
--------------------
   1 | >>> FROM 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17)
   2 |     LABEL maintainer="Instabase, Inc."
   3 |     
--------------------
ERROR: failed to solve: 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17): failed to resolve source metadata for 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17): unexpected status from HEAD request to https://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/v2/instabase-build/python/manifests/3.9.17: 403 Forbidden
make: *** [/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-python.mk:154: build-docker-py-default] Error 1
make: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server'
make: Entering directory '/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server'```
After ~30 mins of failing, it works now. I didn't do anything from my end :shrug:

You likely needed to re-login to ECR, which is handled at sandbox turn-up or a periodic job in the ibdev-backend template. You can manually invoke it in the future with `/home/owner/instabase/.sandbox/ibdev-backend/scripts/ecr-login` :slightly_smiling_face:
